required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Atorvastatin Pre-Treatment Study In Asian Patients With Acute Coronary Syndrome
clinical_study.official_title: A Prospective Randomized, Open-Label, Parallel-Group Comparative Study: Atorvastatin Pre-Treatment Versus Usual Care In Asian Patients With Acute Coronary Syndromes Undergoing Early Percutaneous Coronary Intervention

brief_summary.textblock: This present study is specifically designed to examine the efficacy and safety of a high pre-treatment dose of atorvastatin in Asian patients with NSTE-ACS in China and the Republic of Korea, by using a treatment paradigm similar to that employed in the ARMYDA-ACS study.

primary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE) (Incidence of MACE) at 30 Days Post-percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI)
primary_outcome.description: Percentage calculated as: (number of participants who experienced MACE [death, myocardial infarction, target vessel revascularization] within 30 days post-PCI) divided by (number of participants who experienced PCI) * 100. Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE) that occurred after 33 days post PCI were excluded.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE) (Incidence of MACE) at 8 Hours Post-PCI
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage calculated as: (number of participants who experienced MACE within 8 hours post-PCI) divided by (number of participants who experienced PCI) * 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE) (Incidence of MACE) at 24 Hours Post-PCI
secondary_outcome.description: Percentage calculated as: (number of participants who experienced MACE within 24 hours post PCI) divided by (number of participants who experienced PCI) * 100.

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Elevated Creatine Kinase-MB (CK-MB)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours, 24 hours and 30 days post PCI
secondary_outcome.description: CK-MB above the upper limit of normal range from baseline (biomarker of myocardial injury); normal range: 0-5.0 nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Elevated Troponin I
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours, 24 hours and 30 days post PCI
secondary_outcome.description: Troponin I above the upper limit of normal range from baseline (biomarker of myocardial injury): normal range: 0-0.5 nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percentage of Participants With Elevated Myoglobin
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 8 hours, 24 hours and 30 days post PCI
secondary_outcome.description: Myoglobin above the upper limit of normal from baseline (biomarker of myocardial injury): normal range: 0-109 nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).

secondary_outcome.measure: Percent Change From Baseline in C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
secondary_outcome.description: C-reactive protein percent change from baseline = (post baseline value minus baseline value) divided by baseline value*100. Includes all CRP samples tested for the study, including samples unaffected and those samples affected by defective high-sensitivity (hs) CRP reagents.

intervention.description: 80mg 12 hours pre-Percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI), 40mg 2 hours pre-PCI and 40mg daily after PCI for 30 days.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Non-ST elevated ACS; LDL-C > 80 mg/dl
Exclusion Criteria:
- ST elevated acute myocardial infarction; previously or currently treated with atorvastatin or other statins

link.description: To obtain contact information for a study center near you, click here.

clinical_study.keyword: Asia Lipitor Pre-treatment in Acute Coronary Syndrome

group.title: Atorvastatin
group.description: Atorvastatin 80 mg 12 hours pre- percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) and 40 mg 2 hours PCI, and usual care.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Aspirin 200-300 mg pre-PCI and 100-200 mg daily thereafter; clopidogrel 300 mg loading dose at least 3 hours pre-PCI and 75 mg thereafter; subcutaneous heparin: enoxaparin 1 mg/kg every 12 hours pre-PCI or dalteparin 120 IU/kg every 12 hours pre-PCI; and atorvastatin 40 mg daily after PCI for 30 days.

group.title: Atorvastatin
group.description: Atorvastatin 80 mg 12 hours pre- percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) and 40 mg 2 hours PCI, and usual care.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Aspirin 200-300 mg pre-PCI and 100-200 mg daily thereafter; clopidogrel 300 mg loading dose at least 3 hours pre-PCI and 75 mg thereafter; subcutaneous heparin: enoxaparin 1 mg/kg every 12 hours pre-PCI or dalteparin 120 IU/kg every 12 hours pre-PCI; and atorvastatin 40 mg daily after PCI for 30 days.

group.title: Total
group.description: Total of all reporting groups

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE) (Incidence of MACE) at 30 Days Post-percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI)
outcome.description: Percentage calculated as: (number of participants who experienced MACE [death, myocardial infarction, target vessel revascularization] within 30 days post-PCI) divided by (number of participants who experienced PCI) * 100. Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE) that occurred after 33 days post PCI were excluded.
outcome.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all participants who received at least one dose of study medication and received percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). Last observation carried forward (LOCF).

group.title: Atorvastatin
group.description: Atorvastatin 80 mg 12 hours pre- percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) and 40 mg 2 hours PCI, and usual care.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Aspirin 200-300 mg pre-PCI and 100-200 mg daily thereafter; clopidogrel 300 mg loading dose at least 3 hours pre-PCI and 75 mg thereafter; subcutaneous heparin: enoxaparin 1 mg/kg every 12 hours pre-PCI or dalteparin 120 IU/kg every 12 hours pre-PCI; and atorvastatin 40 mg daily after PCI for 30 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE) (Incidence of MACE) at 30 Days Post-percutaneous Coronary Intervention (PCI)
measure.description: Percentage calculated as: (number of participants who experienced MACE [death, myocardial infarction, target vessel revascularization] within 30 days post-PCI) divided by (number of participants who experienced PCI) * 100. Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE) that occurred after 33 days post PCI were excluded.
measure.population: Full Analysis Set (FAS): all participants who received at least one dose of study medication and received percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI). Last observation carried forward (LOCF).

analysis.groups_desc: Total MACE: treatment difference. Null hypothesis = no difference between the incidence rates in the two groups. A 5% two-sided continuity adjusted Chi-square test was applied.
analysis.estimate_desc: 95% confidence interval for the true difference in the incidence of MACE between the two treatment groups. Difference of incidence = usual care minus atorvastatin.

analysis.groups_desc: Death: treatment difference. Null hypothesis = no difference between the incidence rates in two groups. Fisher’s exact test was applied because the expected frequency of events was less than 5.
analysis.estimate_desc: Confidence limits were calculated by the exact unconditional inference. Difference of incidence = usual care minus atorvastatin.

analysis.groups_desc: Myocardial Infarction: treatment difference. Null hypothesis = no difference between the incidence rates in the two groups. A 5% two-sided continuity adjusted Chi-square test was applied.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference of incidence = usual care minus atorvastatin.

analysis.groups_desc: Unadjusted odds ratio and 95% confidence interval calculated by including treatment group as the only covariate in the logistic regression model. Reference group = usual care.

Adjusted odds ratio: model includes treatment group and potential confounding covariates age, gender, country, non-ST elevation myocardial infarction, LVEF <=40, and use of beta-blockers, ACE-inhibitors, angiotension receptor blockers, calcium channel antagonists, and diuretics. Reference group = usual care.

MACE-free survival up to Day 30. A censoring variable with a value of 1 denoted that the subject had the event and 0 indicated that the subject was censored. A log-rank test was applied to investigate any differences on the survival distribution function between two treatment groups.
analysis.method_desc: Survival analysis: Kaplan-Meier log rank test.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Major Adverse Cardiac Events (MACE) (Incidence of MACE) at 8 Hours Post-PCI
outcome.description: Percentage calculated as: (number of participants who experienced MACE within 8 hours post-PCI) divided by (number of participants who experienced PCI) * 100.

measure.description: Percentage calculated as: (number of participants who experienced MACE within 8 hours post-PCI) divided by (number of participants who experienced PCI) * 100.

analysis.groups_desc: Treatment difference (%). Null hypothesis = no difference between the incidence rates in the two groups. A 5% two-sided continuity adjusted Chi-square test was applied.
analysis.estimate_desc: Difference of incidence = atorvastatin minus usual care.

outcome.title: Percentage of Participants With Elevated Creatine Kinase-MB (CK-MB)
outcome.description: CK-MB above the upper limit of normal range from baseline (biomarker of myocardial injury); normal range: 0-5.0 nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).
outcome.time_frame: 8 hours, 24 hours and 30 days post PCI
outcome.population: FAS. N = number of participants with baseline and at least one post-baseline response.

group.title: Atorvastatin
group.description: Atorvastatin 80 mg 12 hours pre- percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) and 40 mg 2 hours PCI, and usual care.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Aspirin 200-300 mg pre-PCI and 100-200 mg daily thereafter; clopidogrel 300 mg loading dose at least 3 hours pre-PCI and 75 mg thereafter; subcutaneous heparin: enoxaparin 1 mg/kg every 12 hours pre-PCI or dalteparin 120 IU/kg every 12 hours pre-PCI; and atorvastatin 40 mg daily after PCI for 30 days.

measure.title: Percentage of Participants With Elevated Creatine Kinase-MB (CK-MB)
measure.description: CK-MB above the upper limit of normal range from baseline (biomarker of myocardial injury); normal range: 0-5.0 nanograms per milliliter (ng/mL).
measure.population: FAS. N = number of participants with baseline and at least one post-baseline response.

analysis.groups_desc: 8 hours post-PCI: difference (%) in proportions. Null hypothesis = no difference in proportions of the two groups. A 5% two-sided continuity adjusted Chi-square test was applied.
24 hours post-PCI: difference (%) in proportions. Null hypothesis = no difference in proportions of the two groups. A 5% two-sided continuity adjusted Chi-square test was applied.

30 days post-PCI: difference (%) in proportions. Null hypothesis = no difference in proportions of the two groups. Fisher's exact test was applied because the expected frequency of biomarker elevation was less than 5.

outcome.time_frame: 8 hours, 24 hours and 30 days post PCI
outcome.population: FAS. N = number of participants with baseline and at least one post-baseline response.

outcome.title: Percent Change From Baseline in C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
outcome.description: C-reactive protein percent change from baseline = (post baseline value minus baseline value) divided by baseline value*100. Includes all CRP samples tested for the study, including samples unaffected and those samples affected by defective high-sensitivity (hs) CRP reagents.
outcome.population: FAS. N = number of subjects with non-missing values at baseline.

group.title: Atorvastatin
group.description: Atorvastatin 80 mg 12 hours pre- percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) and 40 mg 2 hours PCI, and usual care.

measure.title: Percent Change From Baseline in C-Reactive Protein (CRP)
measure.description: C-reactive protein percent change from baseline = (post baseline value minus baseline value) divided by baseline value*100. Includes all CRP samples tested for the study, including samples unaffected and those samples affected by defective high-sensitivity (hs) CRP reagents.
measure.population: FAS. N = number of subjects with non-missing values at baseline.

analysis.groups_desc: 8 hours post-PCI: difference (% change).
24 hours post-PCI: difference (% change).
30 days post-PCI: difference (% change).

reported_events.desc: Safety analysis set: all randomized subjects with at least 1 dose of treatment. An adverse event (AE) term may be reported as both a serious and a non-serious AE, but are distinct events. AE may = serious for 1 subject and non-serious for another subject, or subject may have experienced both a serious and non-serious episode of the same event.

group.title: Atorvastatin
group.description: Atorvastatin 80 mg 12 hours pre- percutaneous coronary intervention (PCI) and 40 mg 2 hours PCI, and usual care.

group.title: Usual Care
group.description: Aspirin 200-300 mg pre-PCI and 100-200 mg daily thereafter; clopidogrel 300 mg loading dose at least 3 hours pre-PCI and 75 mg thereafter; subcutaneous heparin: enoxaparin 1 mg/kg every 12 hours pre-PCI or dalteparin 120 IU/kg every 12 hours pre-PCI; and atorvastatin 40 mg daily after PCI for 30 days.

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: Pfizer has the right to review disclosures, requesting a delay of less than 60 days. Investigator will postpone single center publications until after disclosure of pooled data (all sites), less than 12 months from study completion/termination at all participating sites. Investigator may not disclose previously undisclosed confidential information other than study results.

clinical_results.limitations_and_caveats: Defective high-sensitivity C reactive protein reagents showed instability and 20% average positive bias in results, affecting only change from baseline in CRP. Analyses were performed on all samples; results include affected and unaffected samples.
